channel.title: Someone please help! [Rep++]
channel.description:
Ok I've posted this about 3 times because no one has answered which is really bloody annoying.
I got a new server but whenever I try to connect it just says "No response from server. Please try using a different world."
On the server it says Connection rejected or w/e.
Rep ++ if you help

item.title: Someone please help! [Rep++]
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

The port the client is connecting from doesn’t change anything. It’s the endpoint port that matters. If you’re connecting to port 43594, then the client’s “connecting from” port can be anything between 1000-65535.

Read full topic

item.title: Someone please help! [Rep++]
item.dc:creator: @Bumm85 Bumm85
item.description:
@Bumm85 wrote:

Yes, the ports change everytime I try to connect in client.java the ip is set to 43495. Will the other client be able to connect to the server? (May null when logging in)

Read full topic

item.title: Someone please help! [Rep++]
item.dc:creator: @Nasz Nasz
item.description:
@Nasz wrote:

[quote=“Bumm85, post:3, topic:394351”]The server is pur3zscape.

Anyway here’s the whole server cmd when I start it up and try to log in -

[2011/05/09 18:57:49] [GameEngine]: Listening on port 43594. ^ | [2011/05/09 18:57:49] [AnonymousIoService-1]: New session from: /127.0.0.1:49692 ^ | [/quote]

Note: It closes your session because you aren’t on the correct port…

That has to be the problem… the ports are different as most of us are saying, are you compiling after you save the changes? And if their not different, try changing the ports in both your source file and client…

In your client file you can change the port in client.java
and…
In your source file you can change the port in Main.java

If your problem still continues, I could give you a different client to try :P. But I notice the ports keep randomizing?

Read full topic

item.title: Someone please help! [Rep++]
item.dc:creator: @oldskoolpk oldskoolpk
item.description:
@oldskoolpk wrote:

[2011/05/09 18:57:56] [AnonymousIoService-3]: New session from: /127.0.0.1:49695[2011/05/09 18:57:56] [AnonymousIoService-3]: Session has been closed: /127.0.0.1:49695

The client’s Port is set to “49695”

/127.0.0.1:49695
and the server's Port is set to "43594"
Port is listening on port: 43594

Try to change the source’s Port to 43594.

Read full topic

item.title: Someone please help! [Rep++]
item.dc:creator: @mr_pker01 mr pker01
item.description:
@mr_pker01 wrote:

[quote=“Bumm85, post:5, topic:394351”]Nup, that’s not it. The port is set to 43594.
Any other help you know?[/quote]

Yes, you need to change it …

Read full topic

item.title: Someone please help! [Rep++]
item.dc:creator: @Bumm85 Bumm85
item.description:
@Bumm85 wrote:

Nup, that’s not it. The port is set to 43594.
Any other help you know?

Read full topic

item.title: Someone please help! [Rep++]
item.dc:creator: @Nasz Nasz
item.description:
@Nasz wrote:

I think the ports are different… :rolleyes:

In your Client file, open client.java, and do ctrl+f 127.0.0.1, above it should show the port… if yours says 49698 (or you could search for 49698), change it too 43594, or change your server port in Main.java in your Source files. If that’s not it just post back :rolleyes:

Read full topic
